name: Kid's Flicks Quiz | Movie Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which iconic character did Roger Craig Smith voice in the 2012 film "Wreck It Ralph"?
questions.explanation:
Sonic the Hedgehog.

	Roger Craig Smith voiced Bruce Wayne/Batman in both "Batman Unlimited" films and for a 22-episode web series released on the DC Kids' animation internet app. He voiced Sonic on "Wreck It Ralph" as well as the TV series "Sonic Boom", and more than a dozen video games. Sonic first debuted in a 1991 Sega Genesis video game and has since been in movies, television, novels and more.

questions.text: What location was the movie "Aladdin" (1992) set primarily in?
questions.explanation:
Agrabah.

	Aladdin was a street urchin before he went into the Cave of Wonders and found the magical lamp with a genie inside. The movie spawned several straight to video sequels and a television series. Agrabah was ruled by a Sultan, whose daughter was in search of a proper suitor. Aladdin used the genie from the lamp to turn himself into a prince so he could attempt to earn her hand in marriage.  The city is located near the Jordan River, as is told by the narrator in the opening scenes.

questions.text: Which actor portrayed Harry Potter on the big screen?
questions.explanation:
Daniel Radcliffe.

	There were seven book in the "Harry Potter" series, but the final book was split into two separate films, making a total of eight film appearances for all the major cast members. All four options played characters in the film franchise. Radcliffe grew up on screen with the character as the movies came out from 2001 to 2011. Radcliffe, born in 1989, was 11 when he was cast as Harry. He made his film debut in "The Tailor of Panama" which was released a few months before the first "Potter" film. He made his television debut in 1999 with the made-for-TV movie "David Copperfield".

questions.text: What color was the brick road that Dorothy and her friends followed in "The Wizard of Oz?
questions.explanation:
Yellow.

	Dorothy, along with the Cowardly Lion, Tin Man, Scarecrow and Toto followed the yellow brick road to find the wizard. Along the way she met up with several challenges that the group was able to overcome despite the odds and their individual fears. Dorothy followed the yellow brick road through the land of Oz until she finally found the wizard, who turned out to just be another traveler, and got the information on how she could return home to Kansas.

questions.text: What type of animal was Nemo from "Finding Nemo"?
questions.explanation:
Fish.

	Nemo was a clown fish. The movie followed the adventures of his father, Marlin, as he attempted to track down and bring home his young son. The movie was made by Pixar Animation Studios.

questions.text: What ancient society's gods are some of the characters from "Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief" descended from?
questions.explanation:
Greek.

	Percy Jackson was the son of Poseidon.  The movie followed his life as he found out that he was the son of the Greek god of the sea, learned to harness his inherited powers and caught the person who had stolen Zeus' Lightning Bolt. There were several books in the series that the movie was based on.

questions.text: "Puss in Boots" was spun off of what other children's movie?
questions.explanation:
Shrek.

	Puss was a cat that acted a lot like Zorro in the "Shrek" films. Voiced by Antonio Banderas, he was one of the break-out stars of the franchise, and earned his own movie. Banderas, Salma Hayek, Zach Galifianakis, Billy Bob Thornton and Amy Sedaris all voiced characters in the movie. An animated cartoon based on the same character was created by Netflix in 2015, but Banderas did not return for the voice duties.

questions.text: Which character made a deal with an evil witch to get a pair of legs in "The Little Mermaid"?
questions.explanation:
Ariel.

	Ariel made a deal with the evil witch Ursula so she could meet Prince Eric. Unfortunately part of the deal was she had to give up her voice in exchange for the legs. She had to convince Eric it was true love without being able to speak to him.

questions.text: In which film did Tim Allen first portray Santa Claus?
questions.explanation:
The Santa Clause.

	Allen, who was best known for starring on television on "Home Improvement" at the time became a huge box office draw when he played Scott Calvin, the man who would become Santa in "The Santa Clause" (1994). The movie spawned several sequels.

questions.text: What extinct creatures were featured in "The Land Before Time"?
questions.explanation:
Dinosaurs.

	Among the options only Dinosaurs ever actually existed the others are made up from other film and television series. The first movie in "The Land Before Time" franchise was released in 1988, with more than a dozen sequels being produced over the years. The film follows Littlefoot, a plant eating dinosaur who was orphaned when his mother was killed by a predator. The rest of the story is about his quest to find the Great Valley and be reunited with others of his own species.
